title: forest ep (my crappy music here)
content:
As some of you may know I try to do some electronic music once in a while. Well, I've been working on an ep, "forest ep". I just didn't invent an artist name for this one, so don't wonder why there is none.

This music is quite simplistic, to some people, but can be nicely bass driven too. What I've noticed it sounds the best with either headphones or pretty loud speakers!

Anyways. This ep was meant to be released in all different place than this forum, but I just dropped it. I didn't feel like working on the songs any more (on some I've worked quite a long time already, on and off), although some might need something (or then not), and there was going to be five songs on this ep. Well, I didn't bother to include one. I have a few that need some finishing.. As well, there is no intro or such, as I originally meant. There is no nice cover or such, which I originally meant to photograph by myself. In other words, I'm disappointed how this turned out. This was going to be something good.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

And just to say, the software I'm using, Buzz fucling tracker, is damn buggy, crashes often, mostly I can't get it working no matter how I try, and last, I don't know much of the special stuff in it -- the sound might be a bit lower than in average cd track. Well, just turn up the volume a bit more!

Anyways, me, KeenRush, have "composed" this crap. Hopefully at least someone likes it. Hopefully you can post your comments. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

This is partly because Spleen encouraged me to show my crappy music in public more. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] He hasn't heard these tracks yet, as has nobody else but me.

Listen in this order. Total play time 25:41.


quickone
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/keenrush/quickone.mp3]www.keengrid.net/keenrush/quickone.mp3[/url]
This was named 'quickone' because I started it day before my 19th birthday, and expected to finish it while I still was 18. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Well, I obviously was quite wrong, it took a lot longer. Anyways, this track has nicely bass, I guess. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]


calmmind
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/keenrush/calmmind.mp3]www.keengrid.net/keenrush/calmmind.mp3[/url]
I started this track to relieve my anger and frustration as I felt I was going insane. Well, this monotrack track may reflect insanity a bit, perhaps. It's a bit on the experimental side.


synthic
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/keenrush/synthic.mp3]www.keengrid.net/keenrush/synthic.mp3[/url]
This is one of my favourite tracks so far. It has a good drive or something, I like it. It's also my most recent track. Also a bit faster than my usual songs.


licht
[url=http://www.keengrid.net/keenrush/licht.mp3]www.keengrid.net/keenrush/licht.mp3[/url]
When I made this track I always knew it will be the finale track of forest ep. Features some nice crispy loops. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] Not very light track.. (Pun intended.) [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mort.gif[/img]


Have fnu! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: my humble opinion
content:
I had fnu... I mean fun, listening to your music [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Ok, I admit it was not the kind of music I usually listen to. I like the last one the most, and didn't like the second one at all, but anyways I don't think I'd be able to make music like this in a hundred years. It doesn't mean that you have reached the highest level of music creation [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] there is still lot to learn. For example I missed more instruments, and the music was a bit ... well... boring at places, but all in all, it's not bad. Just practice and make more![hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Re: my humble opinion
content:
I tried it, and it's like all electronic music which means that I just don't get it.-----------------
[img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/s/jcw/img/logo_jamster_navi.gif[/img][img]http://www.jamster.co.uk/storage/view/335/0/cr/CrazyFrog___Axel_F_Falling.gif[/img]

title: Re: my humble opinion
content:
I like, but they don't really do much. I can only listen to the same loop for so long. On the other hand, if I were the raver type I might feel differently.

It seems like we have kind of the same problem: once you've got a good riff/loop, it's really hard to know where to go from there.________________
[img]http://img80.imageshack.us/img80/8498/missouriansf9.png[/img]

title: Re: my humble opinion
content:
Hmm... To be honest, I don't really like the music. The amount of notes isn't much, the riffs are mediocre to bad and way too repetitive, the noise is annoying...

Well SORRY for offending YOU, sir! Naa kidding. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] I'm sure there are people who do like this kind of music.____________
I have a boring signature.

...
Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site[/url].

title: Re: Monotrack
content:
PCKF definitely isn't the right target audience for this kind of music, not at all, I know, but as you can read this thing went ruined and I decided just to release it here.. (Perhaps I should mention about it to some monotrack fans elsewhere.) Thanks for honest comments, anyways. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Too bad this topic didn't attract more attention, I would've liked to hear more comments. (Even negative ones.) This stuff (except 'synthic') tries to be monotrack, which isn't exactly mainstream. If I do more music (if I ever get new software) my sound will go to more harsh/noiseish direction. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Yeah, it's repeative, perhaps disturbing at times, but that's what monotrack often is.. Not all electronic music is that melodic and progressive, as you people know. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Monotrack
content:
As a giant fan of electronic music and a long time composer of it, this is a good start. Your structures at the moment are a bit simple, but you have to right idea for the trance / rave asspect that I know you are interested in. Im personally more for experimental electronic music. Learn how to opperate a synthesizer and get ahold of effects. Practice your patterns and song structure elements. It takes time and work to get it down. Ive been making electronic music for 4 years.

Heres a song I did if youre interested:
[url=http://www.beardologyrecords.com/mp3s/Straying_The_Path.mp3]www.beardologyrecords.com...e_Path.mp3[/url][img]http://imagegen.last.fm/asimpleblue5/recenttracks/Mr12000.gif[/img]

title: music
content:
Interesting stuff. I've listened to "calmmind" and most of "synthic" so far, and there was one hard-to-describe section of "calmmind" that I particuarly liked. Edit: And "licht" contains some rather good distorted percussion/noise sounds.

Perhaps I should try and write some electronic music. I've been meaning to for a while, but I've never really made much of an attempt. I still need to get around to recording my album... I have been recording some stuff lately, though.------------------
Nothing in particular

title: Re: music
content:
Listened to all of them now. I like the use of noise in the first track. You should definitely write more if you get a better tracking program.------------------
Nothing in particular

title: Re: music
content: Too much noise and repetition. But its a good start.
